comment: Great concept and a very useful app. Unfortunately I use Vivaldi so I have problems logging into google. In Chrome it works perfectly. The authenticator it's much better as Googles. Customer support it's outstanding. Totally worth to get it!

author: Gregor A
comment: Great concept, UI falls short, clumsy and cumbersome to configure and use.
I think this best Google authenticator as if my phone gets lost then I still have it backup to my account. Which why I like your app.

author: Dan Edwards
comment: Very cool. Taking screen-names, Kickin' pASSwords.👌

author: Haruhiko Davis
comment: Needs support for gaming and other MFA platforms. No support for Android Wear. Import passwords fail for LastPass when there are Secured Notes or comments.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: If you'd write in to our support email, we'd be more than happy to try and resolve your issues, and hopefully earn a 5-star review.

author: Karry Johnson
comment: I like but more customization support would be awesome.

author: Eric Noriega
comment: Works well for system login. Kinda slow and fat though. The Mac client can take a long time to pop up especially if it times out and you try again. The phone client uses a fair bit of space, battery, and data. Always at the top of usage for apps.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: Dear Eric, we try to streamline as much as possible, but given the broad range of features SAASPASS supports, there’s a minimum footprint. Later versions of SAASPASS fixed issues you brought up. We strive always to earn 5 stars, & hope you’ll revisit your rating after updates. Also, please don’t hesitate to write in to our support with feedback.

author: Dale Driver
comment: I'm not easily impressed. However this one does and added to one of very few applications that I highly recommended without hesitation. Thier support service is amazing and very helpful.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: Dear Dale, thanks for the 4 stars! Please write in to our support if you're still having issues with the Linux SSH. Instructions can vary and have quirks depending on what flavor of linux you're running. We're happy to help troubleshoot. We'd like to help right things to a 5-star level!

author: Indra Nurwibisono
comment: Kinda slow, cant sync on local network... I hope it will so it can fast

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: We would appreciate if you could write in to our support email if you still have issues, as we try our best to earn 5-star reviews from all our users.

author: Abu Bakar Sidik
comment: It so bad

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: Can you clarify exactly what your issue was? We want to make sure you’re fully aware of all of SAASPASS’ capabilities, and that you don’t have any issues based on not knowing how to use SAASPASS. Especially as it is highly unusual that we get less than 4-5 stars when someone fully understands the use cases for SAASPASS.

author: James Sanderson
comment: Excellent app! Password manager & Authenticator in 1. Now it's a breeze to sign into my Facebook, Gmail, Amazon etc... all with a single click, even with strong security.

author: Martin Dimitrievski
comment: Simplicity is just in our hands.

author: dk wamp
comment: Hi man, can you add skrill and NETELLER to authenticator?

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: In future, use Feedback for feature requests. Skrill & Neteller are supported. Even if not listed, as long as it supports Google Authenticator, then we support it as well. The only difference is that when it is listed, we support full autologin, where SAASPASS will also autofill your authenticator code. Is that the only reason why we got 3 stars?

author: Jordan Williams
comment: I have to say my tests so far indicate this isn't great software. Majority of my connections over 4G Globe network here (I'm in the Philippines) timeout, for which the app locks the UI for 1 minute while it waits for the timeout (poor error handling, UX) so I can't try again quickly - I have to wait the full minute. Even over wifi, many times it takes 1+ minute while I sit here and stare at the screen for it to unlock (Sasspass server has poor performance/lag overseas). Bluetooth proximity unlock isn't available for my LG G3 android phone (poor compatibility), so the best/fastest/most reliable way to log into my computer is to open the Saaspass app, get a "computer login" code and type it manually with my computer login, which basically reduces the app to a simple key generator. This is painful.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: Unfortunately we can't account for the speed of internet connections all across the world. We place our servers based on the preponderance of our customers. SAASPASS goes beyond a simple key generator, as it is the "Lock" securing your machine, with Single Sign-On for enterprise apps and personal services (through integrated password manager)

author: Christopher Jones
comment: Great app. Does what it says. Highly recommend.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: This was an issue that affected some public beta users when we moved to version 2.0. Removing and re-adding the authenticators solves the issue.

author: Warren Henry Fabe
comment: Like the multi platform aspect syncing

author: Steve Postlethwaite
comment: Why won't the App open it used yo work

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: Please write in to our support with any issues. Hopefully this was resolved!

title: Won't open

author: A Google User
comment: Won't even open.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: In future, please write in to our support with any issues. The most likely cause was that you were trying to do so on a rooted device. This is a security feature necessary for our enterprise customers.

title: Broken on Nougat

author: Bradley Gizzi
comment: Refuses to open on marshmallow

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: In future, please write in to our support with any issues. The most likely cause was that you were trying to do so on a rooted device. This is a security feature necessary for our enterprise customers.

title: Won't open.

author: Voruganti Ramakrishna Prasad
comment: SAI SONGS

author: Ahmed Taqeer
comment: Shan44
title: Zeeshan

author: Umesh Shukla
comment: Very good

author: CJ Clarke
comment: Be very careful with this app. I thought it was good and now i am locked out of my laptop. Angry is an understatement.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: Dear CJ, you never requested support from our support address. If you delete SAASPASS after pairing, then you can't get back in to your computer. SAASPASS is like putting on a padlock on your computer, with SAASPASS App as key. If anything happens to the key, then you can't open the lock. SAASPASS has numerous ways to safeguard and restore your key

title: CAREFUL

author: Jn Systems
comment: Users, i recommanded another backup on another device because when one app is not working, there is another you can recover from.

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: As we've repeatedly replied to your reviews, for us to do ANYTHING to help you troubleshoot, you must email us at our support email so we can sort out the particular issue you seem to be experiencing. App store reviews are not the venue to be discussing private information that will be necessary to figure out and fix your particular problem.

title: Always keep a backup on another device

author: Adil H. Raza
comment: Hey saaspass dev guys, what's up with this app? After entering pass code it says we are updating the app please be patience.... and then it says network error blah try again??? I am literally locked out of several we sites because I can't get to the 6 digits code screen because of this... can you guys look at it asap? Cheers. PS: my connection is fine I can access internet from the device and one more thing is that I updated my note 4 from android 4.4.4 to 5.1.1 just a few hours ago

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content:
Can you please email our support to resolve the issues that it seems may have arisen from your update from 4.4.4 to 5.1.1

When you write please include your SAASPASS ID and any email accounts you had paired to it and let us know if you had set recovery up when SAASPASS was working for you.

title: Force update within the app??

author: EJ Espinosa
comment: I tried other 2-factor authentication apps and is more secure compared to Google's very own.  Nice touch of Orca like animation but sometimes there's latency which I hope could be fixed with the next update.
title: Awesome App!

author: Mike Downes
comment: I love this App. It is easy, secure and makes the whole log-in processes much easier. Very versatile for my 2FA requirements.
title: Barbara Downes

author: Dario Bertini
comment: Brittle and bloated

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: We keep SAASPASS streamlined as possible for what it does. We can 1) lock and unlock your computers from the app 2) do in-app sign-in and password management to Authenticator protected services 3) help to recover from a lost authenticator. This is intentionally not Google Authenticator. Nothing comes close to SAASPASS' feature set.

author: Mauro Telani
comment: I tried to make recovery to my 2 numbers registered but anyone receive SMS +375 , +39. And is not first time, please solve SMS problems, all my computers are locked

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: The SMS recovery only works if you had previously setup your phone number as the recovery number. We can't send SMS to numbers not associated with a SAASPASS ID.

title: don't work recovery sms

author: kohtan makhing
comment: Like this apk

author: Brandon St.Rose
comment: When I open the app its says we are updating, then I flashes at the bottom in red action not allowed,  it then fails and report no Internet connection try again. I try and it spins for days. (I do have Internet).

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: You must be on a firewall that is blocking the relevant ports. Please email our support team for solutions to this.

title: Doesn't work for me

author: Frank James
comment: This is awesome, but carefully follow all instructions, and make sure you setup Recovery on your app in case something happens to your phone!! I was a little hesitant after reading some reviews that were less than stellar. Now after installing, I think some of the reviewers failed to follow instructions, or blamed it for doing what it should. A few recommendations based on my experience. Saaspass is a security swiss army knife. For the computer, it throws on a 2FA requirement to your Mac or PC.
title: Security Swiss Army Knife, 2FA for your computers & cloud services

author: Rajesh Deshpande
comment: Extremely well designed, all-in-one 2FA app which works so well with almost every app / site / service which supports 2FA / OTP. Integration with Google Authenticator using barcode is a breeze. A must have app for encrypted and enhanced security not only for your mobile but also for Mac or PC. Supports a wide range of apps and sites. Great work dev !
title: Excellent 2FA, OTP app.

author: Mornay Delport
comment: I've been trying the entire evening to recover my data, but I'm not receiving the recovery code. I'll be moving all my data over to another app. Sort this crap out, this is totally unacceptable!!

reply.author: SAASPASS
reply.content: We're sorry you had the problem. The problem was traced to your operator in New Zealand which was blocking recovery codes from various APIs. I believe you recovered. In the future you can save yourself from the vagaries of operators delivery of messages by cloning your SAASPASS ID to a backup device in case you suffer a loss to your primary device.

title: Totally Fed Up With This Crap!!

author: Ertuğrul Yalanız
comment: Awesome!!

author: Jugoslav Mumovik
comment: It works ALOT faster! I love the computer connector as sso for all my accounts
title: Optized new version

author: iqmal fathi
comment: Goodjob mates
title: Easy and well protected your accounts

author: Carlton W. Terry
comment: When used with pc desktop download, makes it impossible to log in without your phone. I use remote unlock to log in.  If you lose your phone make sure you have the one time code safe from your pc.  It also helps with site's  that have 2 step verification.
title: The best protection

author: Selahaddin K
comment: Super easy to use one time password generator. Eliminating the need to input passwords is superb. Wish all 2 step verification and 2fa was available lime this. Even works to unlock my Apple Mac and Windows PC computer.
title: Two factor Authentication and Authenticator

author: Rostem Hairedin
comment: This is the best one time password generator out there and 2 step verification.  Also has cloud based mobile security and single sign on.
title: Best two factor authentication and authenticator
